Backend

Class ProfileSave

  • java.lang.Object
    • Backend.ProfileSave

  • public class ProfileSave
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that contains methods needed to save profiles of the players.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Hubert Rzeminski, Owen Warner, Robbie Southman

      • fileExists

        private static java.lang.Boolean fileExists()
        Checks if the file with profiles exists.
        Returns:
        True if the file exists, false if not.

      • createFile

        public static void createFile()
        Creates the file where the profiles will be stored.

      • profileExists

        private static java.lang.Boolean profileExists(Profile profile)
        Checks if the given profile exists in the file.
        Parameters:
        profile - The profile to find.
        Returns:
        True if the given profile exists in the file, false if not.

      • addProfile

        public static void addProfile(Profile profile)
        Adds a profile to the file.
        Parameters:
        profile - The profile to add.

      • updateProfile

        public static void updateProfile(Profile profile,
                                 java.lang.Boolean playerWon)
        Updates a profile in the file.
        Parameters:
        profile - Profile to update.
        playerWon - True if the player has won, false if the player has lost.

      • isContain

        private static boolean isContain(java.lang.String source,
                                 java.lang.String subItem)
        It will search through the given String and find a match from the other String.
        Parameters:
        source - The source string to search through.
        subItem - The string to search for.
        Returns:
        True if the source contains the sub item.

      • getProfile

        public static Profile getProfile(java.lang.String profileName)
        It will return the profile according the name of the given player.
        Parameters:
        profileName - The name of the profile.
        Returns:
        The profile.
